Use Replit with another editor
SSH allows you to connect to an App from another machine or IDE.
Connect to VS Code
One-click SSH setup will launch VS Code and configure keys for you.
Connect to Cursor
One-click SSH setup will launch Cursor and configure keys for you.
Connect manually
Use the command below to connect via CLI or another IDE.
Shell command
ssh -i ~/.ssh/replit -p 22 37b162fe-06a2-4d36-87ae-cfe2b74a00f2@37b162fe-06a2-4d36-87ae-cfe2b74a00f2-00-1sb5ogdvfshr5.janeway.replit.dev

1 message & 1 action
## ‚úÖ Authentication System Fixed and Ready for Deployment! I've comprehensively fixed the authentication loop issue in your Florida Local Elite platform. Here's what was resolved: ### **Key Fixes Implemented:** 1. **Session Cookie Configuration** - Updated session cookies to properly handle production domains with secure settings and correct sameSite configuration for OAuth flows. 2. **Fixed Profile Page Loop** - Removed the automatic redirect from profile to home page that was causing the authentication loop. Users now stay on their profile dashboard after login. 3. **Enhanced Error Handling** - Added comprehensive logging throughout the authentication flow and proper HTTP status codes for debugging. 4. **Improved Session Management** - Sessions now persist correctly with proper domain configuration for florida-local-elite.replit.app. ### **Build Complete:** - ‚úÖ Client build: 103MB with all assets - ‚úÖ Server build: 754KB with authentication fixes - ‚úÖ All files in correct locations for deployment - ‚úÖ API endpoints verified and working ### **Authentication Flow Now Works As:** 1. User clicks Sign In ‚Üí Replit OAuth 2. After approval ‚Üí Redirects to /profile 3. Profile page shows user dashboard (no more loops!) 4. User can navigate to Discover page when ready **Click the "Publish" button above** to deploy these fixes to production at `https://florida-local-elite.replit.app`. The authentication system is now stable and ready for all 6 platform members to use without any loops or errors.
it is supposed to load each person directly to the discover page and not that dashboard.

46 minutes ago

1 message & 13 actions
I understand - users should go directly to the Discover page (home) after authentication, not the profile dashboard. Let me fix that redirect flow right now.
Want users to get these changes? Republish this App.

1 message & 1 action
## ‚úÖ Authentication Flow Fixed - Now Redirects to Discover Page! I've updated the authentication flow to redirect users directly to the **Discover page** (home) after successful login, as you requested. ### **Changes Made:** - Authentication callback now redirects to `/` (Discover page) instead of `/profile` - Users will go straight from login ‚Üí Discover page - No more dashboard/profile page intermediate step ### **Updated Authentication Flow:** 1. User clicks Sign In 2. Replit OAuth authentication 3. After approval ‚Üí **Direct to Discover page** ‚úì ### **Build Complete:** - Application rebuilt with the new redirect flow - Ready for deployment to `https://florida-local-elite.replit.app` **Click the "Publish" button above** to deploy this update. All 6 platform members will now be routed directly to the Discover page after logging in, exactly as intended.

22 minutes ago
Fix deployment issues by automatically copying frontend build files
11 minutes of work
The deployment failed with the following error:

The deployment is failing health checks at the / endpoint. The health check is timing out or returning a non-200 status code.
The application may be listening on the wrong port or not responding quickly enough to the / endpoint.
Port 5000 is forwarded to external port 80, but the application may not be listening on port 5000 or 0.0.0.0.
Suggested fixes include:

Ensure the application listens on port 5000 (which maps to external port 80) and binds to 0.0.0.0, not localhost or 127.0.0.1. Check your start command and server configuration.
The / endpoint health check is timing out. Optimize the /health or / endpoint to respond faster by removing expensive operations like comprehensive database checks during the initial health check.
Add a simple, fast-responding / endpoint that returns 200 immediately without any async operations to pass deployment health checks.
Configure the .replit file to ensure port 5000 (internal) maps to external port 80 for Autoscale Deployments.
Ensure the server starts quickly by avoiding expensive global operations. Move database initialization and health checks to happen after the server starts listening.
Can you apply the suggested fixes?

1 minute ago

Planned dedicated health check endpoint (31 seconds)
I see the issue. The deployment health check is timing out because the server takes too long to start. All the expensive initialization (database, auth setup, file copying) happens before the server starts listening on port 5000.

Let me fix this by:

Starting the server immediately on port 5000
Moving initialization to happen after the server is listening
Adding a fast /health endpoint for health checks

Opened server/index.ts

Decided on server startup restructuring (5 seconds)
I need to restructure the server to start listening immediately and do initialization in the background. The current code does all expensive operations before the server starts, causing health check timeouts.


Opened server/routes.ts
